intro: Comesperma volubile, commonly known as the climbing everlet, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its climbing habit and small, fragrant flowers. The plant produces yellowish-white flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in coastal and sandy soils, often found in shrublands and open forests. The fruit is a small, fleshy capsule that contains several seeds.
